items.descriptor: Assess how safe and supported team members feel when expressing themselves
items.raw: Psychological Safety Assess how safe and supported team members feel when expressing themselves

entries.descriptor: Team members fear retribution for speaking up or admitting mistakes.
Team culture discourages vulnerability, and failures are rarely discussed.
Some team members feel comfortable sharing concerns, but others remain silent.
Occasional open conversations happen, but only within small subgroups.
Team generally feels safe raising blockers, asking for help, or sharing new ideas.
Feedback is encouraged and usually leads to constructive outcomes.
Mistakes are discussed in retrospectives as learning opportunities, not blame sessions.
Team openly surfaces risks, challenges, and divergent perspectives during all ceremonies.
Leaders model vulnerability, and all team members are empowered to give and receive feedback.
Psychological safety is regularly assessed and discussed as part of team health.

yesNoInProgress.meta-description: Three options to determine if an action is not started, in progress, or completed
